data.title: Top Ghost Trains And Spooky Rides Across America
data.meta_description: From St. Augustine, FL to Fillmore, CA, we've reviewed a variety of ghost train and haunted tours across America to select the 10 best!
data.text:
This family-friendly, frightseeing tour was recently selected as one of the nation’s best ghost tours in a USA Today reader’s poll and it guarantees a ghoulishly good time for scare-seekers everywhere. Walk through the Old Jail where the tortured souls of former inmates still yearn for justice and discover Potter’s Wax Museum’s Chamber of Horrors where you’ll hear the tale of pirate Andrew Ranson’s gruesome execution. Listed on the Florida and National Register of Haunted Places, there’s plenty of hair-raising to be had in St. Augustine.

Tweetsie Railroad has got you covered. Tweetsie Railroad transforms from the Wild West into a haunted park with Halloween thrills and chills for all ages. The highlight of each evening is a nighttime ride on the Ghost Train. Other spooky attractions include the Haunted House and the Freaky Forest. Younger ghouls will enjoy dressing up in their Halloween costume, trick-or-treating on Main Street, watching the Black Light Puppet Show and taking in the amusement rides in the Creepy Carnival.

Guests enjoy a three-course gourmet dinner made fresh on board while taking part in an interactive comedy show from Kevin O’Brien’s Upstage Productions. Upon boarding the train, some guests are assigned new identities for the evening. Others may even become suspects. As the mystery unfolds, a “murder” occurs, and the audience must figure out whodunnit. Each month will feature a different mystery. This ghost tour is bound to entertain and add a dash of mystery to any vacation.

Families with children seven years of age and older can take part in a captivating lunchtime show where eastwood meets westwood. Adult guests are invited to take part in a similar murder mystery dinnertime show. This haunting train ride will have you and your family laughing and screaming from joy!

This creepy haunted ghost train tour is guaranteed to make you scream. The haunted train ride of Old Ely showcases the grim history of Nevada and provides thrill-seekers with an unforgettable experience. They say the Ghost Train of Old Ely comes “alive” in a whole different way. Come see what makes this one of the top ghost train attractions in the country, if you dare!

Sit back as they illuminate Asheville’s dark side with astonishing stories of spirits and spies, ghosts and goblins, hauntings and hoodlums and mountain-made murder and mayhem. Stories include: the legendary Pink Lady of the Grove Park Inn, the haunting of one of Asheville’s most popular bars, the ghost of Church Street, the mystery at the WhiteGate Inn, the child spirits at the haunted hospital, the architect walled into his own church, Nazi agents based in Asheville and much, much more.

Aboard the Ghosts & Gravestones night-time tour, your costumed Ghost Host will transport you to some of the city’s most haunted sights. Travel through the historic district on a historically haunting ghost tour adventure you won’t soon forget. For those who are curious about the existence of spirits or just plain ready for a spooky adventure, book a ride on the Trolley of the Doomed.

Since 1995, families from across the nation have come to Haunted Atchison Tours, a one-hour narrated ride aboard the Atchison Trolley, to see the sites and hear about the mysteries. Experience the history and mystery that make the charming town of Atchison legendary in haunting. This spine-chilling tour may not be suitable for children under the age of six.

Hop aboard the “Trolley of the Doomed” as their knowledgeable guides share tales of ghostly sunken ships, haunted lighthouses and mysterious happenings on the darker side of this spirited peninsula. Join the scary, fun, and informative filled tour that is truly one of a kind. This tour may not be suitable for children under the age of five.
